repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:  Extui does not route messages emitted as a result of a typed
          command to the "more" window.
          Command message leading shell messages is missing a kind.
          Messages not routed to 'cmdheight' area after it was 0.
Solution: Route messages that were emitted in the same event loop as an
          entered command to the "more" window. Also append multiple
          messages in an already open more-window.
          Assign it the `shell_cmd` kind.
          Change message position when 'cmdheight' changes from 0.

Fix #33920

comment_data.body: Could also group it with the `shell_out` message but the specificity may be useful to filter out the message that would still be visible in the cmdline if entered interactively.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -832,6 +832,7 @@ must handle.
 		"quickfix"	Quickfix navigation message
 		"search_cmd"	Entered search command
 		"search_count"	Search count message ("S" flag of 'shortmess')
+		"shell_cmd"	|:!cmd| executed command

comment_regular_data.body:
Work on #33783

> interactive

Routing to the more-window based on just the kind may be too eager. I.e. I could imagine some mapping/plugin that executes a shell doesn't need to prompt the user, and would suffice to be routed to `ext.cfg.msg.pos`. Same for `:=` which we want to be routed to the more-window when executed interactively, but this is currently assigned the same kind as any print message from Lua which need not necessarily prompt the user? WDYT @clason?

I think we cannot do without a way to forcing a specific route, either through options on `vim.print` or `vim.notify` (which we shouldn't forget in this discussion). It may not need to be exposed to users now, but `:=` should unconditionally push to more-window (except possibly if it's just a single line), no matter what `kind` the underlying output has.

I think all messages coming from manually entered commands should be routed to the more-window (if they exceed 'cmdheight'/a reasonable max 'box' height). Not sure if that can be reliably detected already.

Reworked to handle interactive messages. Considered adding a `typed` field to the `ext_messages.msg_show` event as a hint to show the full message but handling it in the extui module turned out to be simpler.

Now all messages emitted as a result of typing a command will be shown in the more-window. I.e. typing:
* `:echo "foo<CR>"` shows the message in the cmdline area normally because it fits.
* `:echo "foo\nbar<CR>"` is routed to the more-window because it spills and was entered interactively.
* `echo "foo\nbar"` executed as a mapping or by a script is shown in the cmdline with spill indicator.

Hi @luukvbaal! Sorry to chime in. There is something I don't get as per the GIF:

1. If I run `:Inspect` manually, then the output is shown in the more-window as expected
2. If I use a mapping like `vim.keymap.set('n', '<Leader>ci', '<Cmd>Inspect<CR>')` then the output is not shown in the more-window and I see a message like `Treesitter[+8]`.  I would have expected this to actually do show the full message in the more-window

![Peek 2025-05-10 10-15](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/102bfd5f-5410-4aa8-8585-6f03e6228a26)
Yes, that's exactly what he explained in the comment right before yours. It's intentional.

Need a way to force the `list_cmd` either in one of the print functions or maybe with `vim._with`, which would be higher leverage. You could try a `nvim_feedkeys()` mapping as a workaround for now (not sure it would work).
Ok, so this intentional for the time being but expected to change? (as it is a bit counterintuitive) Thanks for the replies.

One of the goals of extui is to reduce prompting the user for every message exceeding 'cmdheight'. This should (I think) include messages from plugins. So yes this message with the `lua_print` kind is intentionally cut off (with the spill indicator supposed to prompt the user to press `g<` if they want to see the full message. Plugins need a way to force routing the message to the more-window.

>  Plugins need a way to force routing the message to the more-window.

Ok so for the time being the workaround is to do something like the following:
```lua
vim.keymap.set('n', '<Leader>ci', function()
    vim.cmd('Inspect')
    vim.cmd('normal! g<')
end)
```
Right?

Edit: I moved the discussion to this issue https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/33952

title: fix(extui): route interactive messages to more-window
